meanings.definition: A short sentence or phrase chosen as encapsulating the beliefs or ideals guiding an individual, family, or institution.
meanings.sent1: Our school mottoes inspire us to always do our best.
meanings.sent2: The family mottoes were displayed proudly on their coat of arms.
meanings.sent3: The mottoes on the wall made the classroom feel welcoming and positive.
meanings.sent4: She lived by the mottoes of kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent5: The mottoes engraved in stone reminded visitors of the school's values.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed many ancient mottoes from different cultures.
meanings.sent2: The book listed various mottoes used by famous leaders throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The mottoes in the book were so small, it was hard to read them without a magnifying glass.
meanings.sent4: The mottoes of the city echoed through the streets, reminding everyone of its history.
meanings.sent5: The mottoes on the banners fluttered in the wind, catching the attention of passersby.
